result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Gene Mayville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 1:25 pm
INCLUDES 14CF177, 14CF273, 15CF351.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon. Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Andrew Mongin.
Atty Mongin states changes to be made to PSI on the record.
State notes changes to be made to PSI on the record. 
A.M. makes statement. 
M.W. makes statement.
A.W. makes statement.
State makes sentencing arguments.
Defense makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS:
14CF177:
Ct. 1 (Incest with Child)>> 35 Years WSPS- 20 Years IC and 15 Years ES, Consecutive. CONDITIONS: Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program, Compliance with the Department's Sex Offender Rules of Community Supervision, Compliance and Regular attendance with Sex Offender Treatment, attainment of a thorough psychological and psychosexual evaluation, completion of Domestic Violence treatment, Completion of a Cognitive Intervention Program, Full Compliance with any and all agent directed treatment, Follow the rules of the Sex Registration of Community Supervision including geographical restrictions on parks and schools, No use of the internet or social media websites, No Contact with A.J.M. for any reason, No interaction with minor Children (including his own) without an approved sober adult chaperone, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Not eligible for programming. Court finds 883 days credit.

Ct. 2 (Incest with Child)>> 30 Years WSPS- 15 Years IC and 15 Years ES, Concurrent to Ct. 3 and Consecutive to Ct. 1. CONDITIONS: Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program, Compliance with the Department's Sex Offender Rules of Community Supervision, Compliance and Regular attendance with Sex Offender Treatment, attainment of a thorough psychological and psychosexual evaluation, completion of Domestic Violence treatment, Completion of a Cognitive Intervention Program, Full Compliance with any and all agent directed treatment, Follow the rules of the Sex Registration of Community Supervision including geographical restrictions on parks and schools, No use of the internet or social media websites, No Contact with A.J.M. for any reason, No interaction with minor Children (including his own) without an approved sober adult chaperone, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Not eligible for programming. Court finds 883 days credit.

Ct. 3 (Incest with Child)>> 30 Years WSPS- 15 Years IC and 15 Years ES, Concurrent to Ct. 2 and Consecutive to Ct. 1. CONDITIONS: Comply with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program, Compliance with the Department's Sex Offender Rules of Community Supervision, Compliance and Regular attendance with Sex Offender Treatment, attainment of a thorough psychological and psychosexual evaluation, completion of Domestic Violence treatment, Completion of a Cognitive Intervention Program, Full Compliance with any and all agent directed treatment, Follow the rules of the Sex Registration of Community Supervision including geographical restrictions on parks and schools, No use of the internet or social media websites, No Contact with A.J.M. for any reason, No interaction with minor Children (including his own) without an approved sober adult chaperone, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Not eligible for programming. Court finds 883 days credit.

15CF351:
Ct. 1 (Battery)>> 9 Months MCJ, Concurrent to 14CF177.

Case Called: 3:22 pm
Includes 14CF177, 14CF273, and 15CF351.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Theresa Wetzsteon and ADA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Andrew Mongin.
Atty Wetzsteon states brief history of the case. Atty Mongin has been appointed to Defendant. COURT addresses the parties regarding the Speedy Trial Demand. 
Atty Mongin states that Defendant would like to withdrawl the Jury Trial demand and set a Status Hearing. Defendant states that he would like to request Speedy Trial Demand and set a Status Hearing about a month out. State has no objection.
COURT ORDERS: COURT Grants request to Withdraw Speedy Trial Demand.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): K.K.
